document.title: 2010 Alabama Course of Study: Social Studies

79893B1C3B1B4799AEFF1FEDEAB48B7B.description: Evaluating financial, political, and social costs of national security

356550F5631D4E9FA8BE01EE68B8AFBB.description:
Explain the role and consequences of domestic and foreign policy decisions,
including scientific and technological advancements and humanitarian,
cultural, economic, and political changes. Examples: isolationism versus internationalism, policy of
containment, policy of détente, multilateralism, war on
terrorism

AA6EEB1EBEC749268B3723A21ADA6C4D.description:
Explaining how the balance between individual versus majority rule
and state versus national authority is essential to the functioning of
the American democratic society. Examples: majority rule and minority rights, liberty and
equality, state and national authority in a federal
system, civil disobedience and rule of law,
freedom of the press, right to a fair trial,
relationship of religion and government

968FAB4F4FC040A39EFB3DEF63AACE18.description:
Describe the role of citizens in American democracy, including the meaning,
rights, and responsibilities of citizenship; due process and other rights
guaranteed by the Constitution of the United States; and participation in the
election process.

5D5BB7AC02C645E1AB341992A4C7563C.description:
Contrasting strict and loose constructionist views of the Constitution
of the United States

A060124A50A84C1A833C4D4F78F5374D.description:
Describing the shifting political balance of the court system,
including the appointment process, the ideology of justices,
influences on court decisions regarding executive and legislative
opinion, public opinion, and the desire for impartiality

552109D2E10E481C84A52920EAF2AC6C.description:
Identifying the impact of landmark United States Supreme Court
cases on constitutional interpretation Examples: Marbury versus Madison, Miranda versus
Arizona, Tinker versus Des Moines, Gideon versus
Wainwright, Reno versus American Civil Liberties
Union, United States versus Nixon, McCulloch
versus Maryland, Wallace versus Jaffree, Wyatt
versus Stickney, Powell versus Alabama

A001C81A538145E688CC02CCB8647989.description:
Explaining the structure and jurisdiction of court systems of the
United States, including lower courts and appellate courts

3158B29B9D554665AF699E75E42A06CB.description:
Evaluate constitutional provisions of the judicial branch of government of the
United States, including checks by the judicial branch on other branches of
government, limits on judicial power, and the process by which cases are
argued before the United States Supreme Court

56F137E439FC4AF9AA709C95E60A56F2.description:
Comparing diverse backgrounds, socioeconomic status, and levels of
education of United States’ presidents

97737B9D5D084037905D0A58F0CC0052.description:
Ranking powers held by the President’s Cabinet, including roles of
Cabinet secretaries, appropriations by Congress, appointment and
confirmation, and operation of organization

42EFD541A8D7436686BC72B6FFD92E96.description:
Identifying the influence of White House staff on the President of the
United States

80595A3B8C8340B4B3D2FAB3C7544FCC.description:
Critiquing informal powers of the President of the United States,
including press conferences, State of the Union addresses, total
media access, head of party, and symbolic powers of the Oval Office

B0F9BDFCAC3E40FD8BC36212A00D5DF7.description:
Evaluate constitutional provisions of the executive branch of the government
of the United States, including checks by the executive branch on other
branches of government and powers, duties as head of state and head of
government, the electoral process, and the Twenty-fifth Amendment.

9DB40356932B4068BF6DEDC0A74816CD.description:
Tracing the legislative process, including types of votes and
committee action, from a bill’s presentation to presidential action

0CF0ED9EAAB549FC81806077F5A074E9.description:
Identifying the significance of Congressional committee structure
and types of committees

721EE43E80724669BE184DA2704D6973.description:
Comparing rules of operations and hierarchies of Congress,
including roles of the Speaker of the House, the Senate President Pro
Tempore, majority and minority leaders, and party whips

3AED3755209C48D19DF1F801BA51C39E.description:
Evaluate constitutional provisions of the legislative branch of the government
of the United States, including checks by the legislative branch on other
branches of government.

B455138A67F14897894EF4D88FF49FF1.description:
Describing the influence of political parties on individuals and
elected officials, including the development of party machines, rise
of independent voters, and disillusionment with party systems

00A2BFFFE5A64C99ACB075AFCED25920.description:
Explaining major characteristics of contemporary political parties in
the United States, including the role of conventions, party leadership,
formal and informal memberships, and regional strongholds

596085B692D64BA48191836A1A4A221E.description:
Describing the role of third-party candidates in political elections in
the United States

BE76282DD22A401984A2F4E6FF3B148A.description: Evaluate roles political parties play in the functioning of the political system of the United States.

BFE7AE14FA9541169C5BCB76C0C1FBF7.description:
Explaining the effect of attack advertisements on voter selection of
candidates

880DCDFDCC914BE2BEFFAA2B12E64795.description:
Analyzing television and electronic media for their impact on the
election process and campaign spending from the John F. Kennedy-Richard M. Nixon debate to the election of Barack Obama as
President of the United States

17F30C5D696E4A60B8557088DEB2FEBE.description: Describing regional differences in public opinion in the United States

6B69C5BD98FE44E39E433DFEDBB82D67.description:
Trace the impact of the media on the political process and public opinion in the
United States, including party press, penny press, print media, yellow
journalism, radio, television, and electronic media.

2CB16FE4839347BE9427A38BCA7230A5.description:
Analyzing rulings by the United States Supreme Court, including
Buckley versus Valeo, regarding campaign financing to determine the
effect on the election process

CC828D0291FD4BD0AF29F93E74EE45EB.description:
Describe functions and the development of special interest groups and campaign contributions by political action committees and their impact on
state and national elections.

23D4F2A087B349B4950A42E2269F2160.description:
Evaluating the impact of reapportionment, redistricting, and voter
turnout on elections

FAB489822B0F4A94BF21F9AA93FFB142.description: Describe the process of local, state, and national elections, including the organization, role, and constituency of political parties.

8A944F295A074088B2A53E5671A5A752.description:
Analyzing the black codes, the Jim Crow laws, and the Selma-toMontgomery March for their impact on the passage of the Voting
Rights Act of 1965

E5601211BBDE4E03B80E7551BD7E44C0.description:
Describing implications of participation of large numbers of
minorities and women in parties and campaigns

A5B0CB52B8844FEB937B66A7E4E333FD.description:
Analyze the expansion of suffrage for its effect on the political system of the
United States, including suffrage for non-property owners, women, African
Americans, and persons eighteen years of age.

A170D5F5DEDA4382A932C7D240185E76.description:
Describing the influence of special interest groups on state
government

0288828777CE4AA1A0F3A9624CEAFB60.description:
Analyzing the Constitution of Alabama of 1901 to determine its
impact on local funding and campaign funding

56BD13FFBDB84FBCA9918A31C789319E.description:
Compare specific functions, organizations, and purposes of local and state
governments, including implementing fiscal and monetary policies, ensuring
personal security, and regulating transportation.

C926FB92CCBF4D3480A676E89D51D6F6.description: Evaluating the role of the national government in interstate relations

3BDACCD2D078452E9F4C6E709EF40F52.description:
Summarizing obligations that the Constitution of the United States
places on a nation for the benefit of the states, including admitting
new states and cooperative federalism

B3714D03C55E41A99695EE0EECA4A820.description: Explain how the federal system of the United States divides powers between national and state governments.

04B474DDD2DD4AA7916A99C030F16776.description:
Outlining the formal process of amending the Constitution of the
United States

2991F520DBA141539CEF7284DBC68DF1.description:
Analyzing the Bill of Rights for its application to historical and
current issues

9FE9B359F5F341C48FFBA5DC5DABAE3C.description:
Explaining main ideas of the debate over ratification that included
the Federalist papers

B247698AFF5D4F5D870E3D49F0BA869E.description:
Analyze major features of the Constitution of the United States and the Bill of
Rights for purposes, organization, functions, and principles, including rule of
law, federalism, limited government, popular sovereignty, judicial review,
separation of powers, and checks and balances.

F3581B851B7E42C89D8DD551DB8FE077.description:
Summarize the significance of the First and Second Continental Congresses,
the Declaration of Independence, Shays’ Rebellion, and the Articles of
Confederation of 1781 on the writing and ratification of the Constitution of the
United States of 1787 and the Bill of Rights of 1791.

397B9E61077D47719151443FA86F5C7E.description:
Comparing characteristics of limited and unlimited governments
throughout the world, including constitutional, authoritarian, and
totalitarian governments. Examples: constitutional—United States; authoritarian—Iran; totalitarian—North Korea

4DBAA0E62DDA4806975BE0E78090D262.description:
Explain historical and philosophical origins that shaped the government of the
United States, including the Magna Carta, the Petition of Rights, the English
Bill of Rights, the Mayflower Compact, the Virginia Declaration of Rights, and
the influence of Thomas Hobbes, John Locke, Charles de Montesquieu, Jean-Jaques Rousseau, and the Great Awakening.
